by Skial Bainn published on Thursday 29th May 2014

# Haxe Roundup № 157

If you use SublimeText for Haxe development and are already testing v3, then consider trying out the Haxe plugin which is being refactored with brand new features which should work with v2.

The HaxeFlixel team have released a new repository, Flixel Addon's. It contains PhotonStorm's power tools and other community code.

The second ruHaxe online conference took place a few days ago.

Фомкин demonstrated Haxemojos, which is a Maven plugin created to build Haxe projects. YouTube.

  • Slides.

    • Кузьменко demonstrated StablexUI which looks awesome. YouTube.

    AxGord demonstrated Haxe & Unity3D and dotnet support. YouTube.

    Юрий Кетов talked about Haxe evangelism in Russian community. YouTube.

    Also from the ruHaxe community is the HxJointForces github group, who are working on a very ambitious and amazing project, Hxmr.

    Cristian has released his first NME game to the App Store and the Play Store. He has "used TileLayer to get the speed" and made his own Facebook lib with web login.

    The TopHattedCoder has written about "Building LLVM in Haxe" using a new library called haxegen to generate C++ bindings.

    When Joshua released the OpenFL roadmap a few weeks ago, he mentioned alternative HTML5 backends. Well, Jarkko seems to have done it by using Pixi.js. Github.

  • Demo.

    • Фомкин" Кузьменко" Юрий Кетов"
